alert.note: Alert for Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity; South Central Utah; Western Canyonlands (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 01 at 5:01PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Garfield County through 530 PM MDT... At 501 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles east of Boulder, or 19 miles south of Capitol Reef National Park, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Garfield County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity; South Central Utah; Western Canyonlands
